ygData.subject: Re: Exploits
ygData.msgSnippet: Hm. Methinks you can Exploit a bug and call it cheating :P But usually when you take advantage of a good situation, that situation was not intended by the
ygData.messageBody:
Hm. Methinks you can "Exploit a bug" and call it cheating :P
But usually when you take advantage of a good situation, that situation
was not intended by the designers. Actually talking about really good
situation, like where you find bronze stuff on decaying skel or
somesuch. And I'd call that cheating and exploiting.

Hm, guess I don't really differentiate. Give an example where exploiting
is not cheating...

Paul McClung wrote:
>
> From: Paul McClung <p.e.mcclung@...>
>
> There is a difference between an exploit and a cheat.
>
> A cheat requires you use a flaw or bug in the program that wasn't intended
> by the designers to your own advantage.
>
> And exploit is taking advantage of a good situation when it arises.
>
> Cheating is wrong and can be punished by a GM, exploiting is not explicitly
> wrong, but it may or may not go against the spirit of the game.
>
> Rotgut
>
